newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde May 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde May 27.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.

-- President Jacques Chirac seen hesitating between National Assembly speaker Philippe Seguin and former prime Minister Edouard Balladur to succeed outgoing Prime Minister Alain Juppe. Chirac is to make televised speech tonight.

-- An investigation into the terms of a 1992 acquisition by oil group Elf Aquitaine of an oil refinery in Leuna, in the former German Democratic Republic, shows possible illegal transfer of funds from Elf that could amount to 300 million francs.
-- OECD seeks to introduce laws to criminalise bribery of state officials, in a battle against corruption in international business.

-- Former prime minister Edouard Balladur calls in an interview for further cuts in operating outlays by state and local authorities to eventually cut taxes. He also calls for further cuts in payroll charges.
-- Staff at Renault's Vilvoorde plant choose to negotiate with management over planned closure.
